config.question: Why weren’t the Russians keen on the unification of Germany?

choices.content: The people in East Germany voted to stay with Soviet Russia.
Vacating Germany would compromise Russia’s last line of defense.
They feared the responsibility of developing Germany alone.
They feared a resurgence of German military power.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Instead of accepting Stalin as a cautious leader bent on protecting Russian security, western nations perceived him as an aggressive dictator. They saw him leading a communist drive for world domination. See L.O. 28.1 The Cold War Begins.
